GIPOGO Cath Lab Hemodynamics
GIPOGO Cath Lab Hemodynamics
GIPOGO Cath Lab Hemodynamics Quick hemodynamics (RHC)
Calculations Report
Fick: cardiac output CO/CI/SV with weight, height, SaO₂, SvO₂ (PA), Hb, HR and age.
Systemic vascular resistance MAP + CVP + CO. Output in Wood Units or dyn·s·cm⁻⁵.
Cardiac power CPO/CPI with MAP + CO (+ BSA optional).
Pulmonary artery pulsatility index (PASP − PADP) / RAP.
FORMULAS • CaO₂ = 1.34 × Hb × SaO₂ + 0.0031 × PaO₂ • CvO₂ = 1.34 × Hb × SvO₂ + 0.0031 × PvO₂ • ΔC(a−v)O₂ = CaO₂ − CvO₂ • CO (L/min) = VO₂ / (ΔC(a−v)O₂ × 10) • CI (L/min/m²) = CO / BSA • SV (mL) = (CO × 1000) / HR
UNITS / NOTES • Hb in g/dL. Saturations in % (convert if needed). • SvO₂ ideally: mixed venous sample from pulmonary artery. • 0.0031×PO₂ is usually small and can be omitted if blood gases are not available. • VO₂: ideally measured; if estimated, depends on formula/sex/body size.
FORMULAS • SVR (Wood Units) = (MAP − CVP) / CO • SVR (dyn·s·cm⁻⁵) = SVR(WU) × 80
UNITS / NOTES • MAP and CVP (or RAP) in mmHg; CO in L/min. • If non-invasive MAP: MAP ≈ (SBP + 2×DBP)/3. • Use a consistent CO method for comparability.
FORMULAS • CPO (W) = (MAP × CO) / 451 • CPI (W/m²) = CPO / BSA
UNITS / NOTES • MAP in mmHg; CO in L/min. • 451 is the conversion factor to Watts. • Always interpret in clinical context.
FORMULAS • PAPi = (PASP − PADP) / RAP
UNITS / NOTES • PASP, PADP, RAP in mmHg. • RAP = right atrial pressure (RAP/CVP).
PDF Report Ready to generate a PDF with date/time and completed calculations. Perform at least one calculation to enable the report. Open PDF Reset
Quick setup • Swan-Ganz pressures + CO\n• If using Fick: arterial + pulmonary artery sample (SvO₂) and Hb See more
Full setup Close
• Swan-Ganz pressures: RAP (RA), PA (PASP/PADP/mPAP) and PCWP (wedge), ideally at end-expiration.
• If using Fick: systemic arterial sample and mixed venous sample from pulmonary artery (PA). Label sampling site and send for co-oximetry/blood gas for SaO₂/SvO₂ and Hb.
• MAP: preferably invasive arterial line; alternatively non-invasive BP and MAP ≈ (SBP + 2×DBP)/3.
• CO: use a consistent method (thermodilution or Fick) for resistances and power.
Reset Do you want to clear all fields and results? Reset Cancel
SaO₂ SvO₂ Hemoglobin (Hb) Heart rate (HR)
SaO₂ Arterial oxygen saturation. Ideally measured from arterial blood gas or co-oximetry. Typical values: 95–100%.
SvO₂ Mixed venous oxygen saturation. Ideally a pulmonary artery sample (Swan–Ganz catheter). Typical values: 60–80%.
Hemoglobin (Hb) Hemoglobin concentration. Impacts arterial/venous O₂ content used in the Fick equation. Common units: g/dL or g/L.
Heart rate (HR) Heart rate in beats per minute (bpm). Used to derive stroke volume from cardiac output.
Very high; double-check. Too high; please change to proceed.
Next: Vascular resistance
BSA: %1$s m² Patient data Oxygenation Laboratory Heart rate Change Hb unit Copy results
Cardiac output (Fick)
Cardiac output (Fick method) MDCalc-style interface: weight, height, SaO₂, SvO₂, Hb, HR and age. Estimated VO₂ adjusts automatically by age; advanced option for measured VO₂.
Weight / Height Weight Height BSA (Mosteller): %1$s m²
Required variables SaO₂ (arterial) – ideally from blood gas/co-oximetry SvO₂ (mixed) – pulmonary artery sample (PA) via Swan-Ganz Hemoglobin (Hb) – lab Heart rate (HR) Auto-estimated VO₂ by age: %1$s mL/min/m²
Advanced options Hide advanced options Use measured VO₂ (indirect calorimetry) Measured VO₂ Include dissolved component (PaO₂/PvO₂) PaO₂ (arterial) PvO₂ (venous)
Age < 70 years ≥ 70 years
Abbreviations:
Cardiac output (Fick)
CO: %1$s L/min CI: %1$s L/min/m² SV: %1$s mL/beat VO₂ used: %1$s mL/min BSA: %1$s m² CaO₂: %1$s mL/dL CvO₂: %1$s mL/dL A–V diff: %1$s mL/dL VO₂ factor used: %1$s mL/min/m²
• CO: Cardiac Output. • CI: Cardiac Index (CO/BSA). • SV: Stroke Volume (CO/HR). • VO₂: Oxygen consumption. • BSA: Body Surface Area. • CaO₂: Arterial O₂ content. • CvO₂: Venous O₂ content. • A–V diff: Arterio-venous O₂ difference.
Cardiac power
Cardiac power (CPO) and index (CPI) CPO = (MAP × CO) / 451. CPI = (MAP × CI) / 451 when BSA is available.
Variables
Mean arterial pressure (MAP) Preferred: invasive arterial line. Alternative: MAP ≈ (SBP + 2×DBP) / 3.
Cardiac output (CO) From right-heart cath: thermodilution (average) or Fick.
Body surface area (BSA) (optional) Only needed if you want CPI (CPO indexed to BSA).
CPO CPI
Abbreviations: • MAP: Mean arterial pressure. • CO: Cardiac output. • CI: Cardiac index (CO/BSA). • BSA: Body surface area. • CPO: Cardiac power output. • CPI: Cardiac power index.
Review the required fields (Mean Arterial Pressure, Central Venous Pressure, and Cardiac Output).
Systemic vascular resistance Wood Units dyn·s·cm⁻⁵
What does SVR measure? Systemic Vascular Resistance (SVR) estimates resistance to flow in the systemic circulation.\n\nFormula:\nSVR (WU) = (MAP − CVP) / CO\nSVR (dyn·s·cm⁻⁵) = SVR (WU) × 80\n\nMAP: mean arterial pressure\nCVP: central venous pressure\nCO: cardiac output
Optional
Systemic vascular resistance
Variables
Mean arterial pressure (MAP) Central venous pressure (CVP) Cardiac output (CO)
Units Wood Units dyn·s·cm⁻⁵
Systemic vascular resistance Abbreviations: • SVR: Systemic Vascular Resistance. • MAP: Mean arterial pressure. • CVP: Central venous pressure. • CO: Cardiac output. • Wood Units: resistance units. • dyn·s·cm⁻⁵: CGS units.
Systemic Vascular Resistance (SVR)
MAP, CVP and CO are required. CO must be > 0.
PAPi
Pulmonary artery pulsatility index (PAPi) Formula: PAPi = (PASP − PADP) / RAP
Variables
Pulmonary artery systolic pressure (PASP) Pulmonary artery diastolic pressure (PADP) Right atrial pressure / central venous pressure (RAP)
Measure on pulmonary artery tracing via Swan-Ganz. Record PASP. Measure on pulmonary artery tracing via Swan-Ganz. Record PADP. Measure in right atrium via Swan-Ganz (or CVP). Ideally end-expiration.
Result Abbreviations: • PAPi: Pulmonary Artery Pulsatility Index. • PASP: Pulmonary Artery Systolic Pressure. • PADP: Pulmonary Artery Diastolic Pressure. • RAP: Right atrial pressure. • CVP: Central venous pressure. • PA: Pulmonary artery.
Note: %1$s
PASP, PADP and RAP are required. RAP must be > 0. PASP cannot be lower than PADP. Please verify values.
PAPi < 0.9 suggests higher risk of right ventricular dysfunction (per reference tool threshold). PAPi ≥ 0.9: no high-risk criterion by this threshold (interpret in clinical context).
Pulmonary Artery Pulsatility Index (PAPi)
PAPi: %1$s
------------------------------------------
What is PAPi? PAPi (Pulmonary Artery Pulsatility Index) = (PASP − PADP) / RAP.\n\nPASP: pulmonary artery systolic pressure.\nPADP: pulmonary artery diastolic pressure.\nRAP: right atrial pressure.
PAPP RAP
0
Total pulmonary resistance (TPR)
CO SVR CPO PAPI PVR
FICK PRINCIPLE
Pulmonary Vascular Resistance mPAP - PAWP / CO Calculates pulmonary vascular resistance using mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP), pulmonary artery wedge pressure (PAWP), and cardiac output (CO).
mmHg L/min Wood Units dyn·s·cm⁻⁵
Pulmonary Vascular Resistance
Variables Units
Mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP) Pulmonary artery wedge pressure (PAWP) Pulmonary flow (Qp) / Cardiac output (CO)
10–45 4–18 2.0–12.0
Pulmonary Vascular Resistance WOOD UNITS DYN·S·CM⁻⁵
Pulmonary Vascular Resistance Pulmonary resistance calculations based on right-heart catheterization hemodynamics.
PVR (Pulmonary Vascular Resistance, WU) = (mPAP − PAWP) / CO TPR (Total Pulmonary Resistance, WU) = mPAP / CO
Conversion: dyn·s·cm⁻⁵ = WU × 80
mPAP: mean pulmonary artery pressure PAWP: pulmonary artery wedge pressure (surrogate of left atrial pressure) CO: cardiac output
mPAP Mean pulmonary artery pressure measured during right heart catheterization (mmHg).
PAWP Pulmonary artery wedge pressure (also called PCWP), used as a surrogate of left atrial pressure (mmHg).
Qp / CO Pulmonary blood flow (Qp). In the absence of shunt, Qp ≈ CO. If you have measured Qp separately, you may enter it here.
Units Wood units (WU) are the standard for PVR. CGS units are dyn·s·cm⁻⁵ (WU × 80).
Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR)
Missing data: mPAP, PAWP and Qp/CO are required. Cardiac output / flow must be > 0. mPAP − PAWP must be > 0. Check pressures.
Legal notice and disclaimer
Educational use only This application is intended exclusively for educational and instructional purposes. The calculations and recommendations are supportive tools and may depend on input quality, clinical conditions and assumptions. They do not replace comprehensive medical evaluation, clinical guidelines, institutional protocols or clinical judgment.
User responsibility The user (healthcare professional) is solely responsible for: • Verifying entered data (units, measurement source, timing). • Interpreting results in the patient’s clinical context. • Making diagnostic and therapeutic decisions based on professional judgment. • Complying with local regulations and institutional policies.
Limitation of liability The developer assumes no responsibility for direct or indirect damages arising from the use of this application. It is recommended to cross-check results with reliable sources and, when applicable, reference methods.
Privacy Avoid entering identifiable patient information if not necessary. If you choose to do so, you are responsible for handling it in accordance with applicable law.
I have read and accept the terms. I understand that the use and interpretation of the information is my professional responsibility.
